relation: The campus safety officers are all very nice and always arrive quickly of called.
There are many different clubs and organizations to attend at Baker College of Muskegon. RHA(residence hall association) is a great way to meet people and make new friends!
Baker was the cheapest college that I visited. The dorm fees were less than half from other places that I visited !
The beach is only a fifteen minute drive. You can walk to the lighthouse or just go for a swim.
There are three different types of living arrangements, take a tour of each to see what you like best.
With the shorter quarters you have to really stay on top of all of your work. Also make sure you visit all of your prospective colleges before making a choice!

Baker college of Muskegon is absolutely wonderful. Every advisor, instructor, and even member of the residence hall staff is very kind and willing to help. Beautiful campus without programs to choose from.
pageTitle: Baker College of Muskegon Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {180316=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 42063=I was pretty much paying for a high school education and the teachers don't even use correct grammar., 79157=In one year i took 34 credits, so i guess that is rigorous. I go to school 2 days a week from 8:30 to 4:10, so that is about 8 hours. I try my hardest to get all A's and B's in my classes and nothing less}
textBeforeTable: 04/21/2011 Reviewer is Accepted here and planning to attend soon. Reviewer has been to campus. 5 out of 5 people found this review useful. 1 of 42 Melisanda from Zeeland, MI Check out reviews left by other students or leave your own review. textAfterTable: Great for these types of students Just leaving home, looking for a place with a lot of opportunity. Tips for prospective students Walk throughout the school first. Make sure that this is the type of school you're truly looking for. Talk with a counselor, talk with prospective students, and spend some time down in the 'lunchroom' and library. Bang for the buck My classes are quite expensive being lab classes. However, it's much cheaper than another school somewhere else. Regular classes not geared towards Culinary or Baking are much cheaper, however. And, I definitely learn everything I need to know at a reasonable price. Am enjoying being here I walk into every class with a light heart, ready and excited to learn whatever the Chef or Professor has to teach that day. Am learning a lot As a Baking and Pastry Arts student, I am constantly in the lab rooms. I already went through all of my classroom classes, but no matter what I'm doing, I'm enjoying every bit of it, 100%. And of course, learning a LOT every step of the way. Login to
